023package org.opt4j.optimizers.ea;
024
025import java.util.ArrayList;
026import java.util.Collection;
027import java.util.List;
028
029import org.opt4j.core.Individual;
030import org.opt4j.operators.crossover.Pair;
031
032/**
033 * The {@link CouplerDefault} uses the pairs based on their index in the list:
034 * {@code p0+p1,p2+p3,etc.}.
035 * 
036 * @author glass, lukasiewycz
037 * 
038 */
039public class CouplerDefault implements Coupler {
040
041        /*
042         * (non-Javadoc)
043         * 
044         * @see org.opt4j.operator.mating.Coupler#getCouples(int, java.util.List)
045         */
046        @Override
047        public Collection<Pair<Individual>> getCouples(int size, List<Individual> parents) {
048                List<Pair<Individual>> couples = new ArrayList<>();
049                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
050                        Individual first = parents.get((2 * i) % parents.size());
051                        Individual second = parents.get((2 * i + 1) % parents.size());
052                        Pair<Individual> pair = new Pair<>(first, second);
053                        couples.add(pair);
054                }
055                return couples;
056        }
057
058}
